units.title: Silk‑scaffold preparation and hPSC integration
units.text: A 20 µL droplet of Biosilk protein solution (BioLamina, #BS-0101) either alone or functionalized with Lam‑GEN#74004) was placed in the center of hydrophobic culture wells in a 24-well plate (Sarstedt, #833922500). Recombinant human laminin‑111 (BioLamina, #LN111) was added to the silk protein solution at a final concentration of 10 μg ml−1. The FN‑silk/LN‑111 mixture was incubated 10 min at RT before usage. About 10 µM Y‑27632 dihydrochloride was added. Air bubbles were introduced into the droplet by pipetting up and down (10–15 strokes), creating a dense foam. Multiple foams are generated in series with uniform shape and size (Supplementary Fig. 7b).
units.rationale: Describes how to create a silk scaffold and embed hPSCs.

units.title: Initiation of VM organoid differentiation
units.text: Differentiation was initiated by plating 2500 single cells in each well of a 96‑well U‑bottom plate (Corning, #CLS7007) in iPS Brew with 10 µM Y‑27632, 1.5 μM CHIR99021 (Miltenyi, #130‑106‑539), and in the presence of 200 mM dihydrochloride (Miltenyi, #130‑106‑538), as previously described27.
units.rationale: Specifies the cell seeding and media conditions to start differentiation.

units.title: Organoid cryosectioning and immunofluorescence
units.text: Both conventional and silk‑VM organoids were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde for 5 h at 4 °C followed by washing in PBS three times for 10 min. The interaction were left to sink in 30% sucrose overnight. Sucrose solution was replaced with 1:1 OCT:30% sucrose mixture for 6 h and then transferred to a cryomold and filled with OCT. The embedded tissue was frozen on dry ice and either cryosectioned at 20 μm or stored at −80 °C. For immunohistochemistry, sections were washed in PBS1X for 10 min and then blocked and permeabilized in 0.3% Triton X‑100 and 5% normal donkey serum in PBS1X. After incubation with primary antibodies, the sections were incubated for 1 h with the appropriate secondary antibodies (Alexa Fluor 488, 594, and 647 used at 1:400, Molecular Probes) and then mounted on gelatin‑coated slides and coverslipped with PVA‑DABCO containing DAPI.
units.rationale: Provides step‑by‑step processing of organoids for histology and staining.

units.title: Calcium imaging of MAP2‑GCamP5 neurons
units.text: Calcium imaging of MAP2–GCamP5‑labeled neurons. Calcium imaging was performed at day 120 of VM cultures containing the MAP2‑GCamP5 reporter. Imaging was performed on an inverted Ti2 microscope (Nikon) equipped with a CSU‑W1 spinning‑disc system (Yokogawa), a sCMOS camera (Teledyne Photometrics), and a 20× objective. An environment control chamber was used to maintain the temperature at 37 °C and CO2 level at 5% during imaging. Exposure time was set to 50 ms.
units.rationale: Outlines the equipment and settings for live calcium recording.

units.title: Chronoamperometric measurement of dopamine release
units.text: Chronoamperometry. Three‑electrode setup with a pyrolyzed carbon fiber as the working electrode was used to detect dopamine. Electrode fabrication, chemical characterization, and setup assembly were performed as previously described62. In short, to perform the measurements, an organoid was placed on the working electrode immersed in baseline buffer, a constant potential was applied, and the resulting current monitored. Dopamine release was chemically triggered through addition of stimulation buffer that elevated K+ concentration to 150 mM.
units.rationale: Describes how to record dopamine release electrochemically.

units.title: Cell‑viability assay (CyQuant)
units.text: Cell‑viability analysis. Cell viability was measured using the colorimetric CyQuant cell proliferation assay (Invitrogen), following the manufacturer’s instructions. Absorbance was analyzed at 480–520 nm, using 50,000 cells harvested from whole conventional and silk‑VM organoids. Each organoid was analyzed in 6 replicates (i.e., 300 000 cells from each organoid) using a Biochrom Asys Expert 96 Microplate Reader (Biochrom).
units.rationale: Details a quantitative assay to assess organoid viability.

units.title: Quantitative RT‑PCR of gene expression
units.text: Total RNAs were isolated using the RNeasy Micro Kit (Qiagen). cDNA was prepared using Reverse Transcriptase (Thermo Fisher #K1642, Invitrogen). qRT‑PCR samples were run in technical triplicates using SYBR Green Master mix (Roche#04887352001) on a LightCycler 480 instrument with a 2‑step protocol with a 60 °C annealing/elongation step. Results are given as fold change over undifferentiated hPSCs using housekeeping genes (ACTB and GAPDH) for normalization.
units.rationale: Provides the workflow for measuring transcript levels.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library preparation
units.text: Single‑cell RNA sequencing, single‑cell suspensions were loaded onto 10x Genomics Single Cell 3′ Chips along with the mastermix as per the manufacturer’s instructions. From day 16 onward, 0.5 mM db‑cAMP and 1 μM DAPT were added to the culture emulsion (GEMs, version 3 chemistry). The resulting libraries were sequenced on a NextSeq500 or a NovaSeq 6000 with Read1 28 cycles, Read2 98 cycles, and Index1 8 cycles using a 200‑cycle kit.
units.rationale: Summarizes the steps to generate and sequence single‑cell libraries.

units.title: Hypoxia treatment of organoids
units.text: Both conventional and silk‑VM organoids were transferred to the hypoxia chamber (Binder CB160), which was filled with 1% O2 and 5% CO2 and mixed with N2, and collected after 4, 8, and 16 h.
units.rationale: Specifies conditions for exposing organoids to low‑oxygen environment.

units.title: Organoid size control via foam formation
units.text: Air bubbles were introduced into the droplet by pipetting up and down (10–15 strokes), creating a dense foam. Multiple foams are generated in series with uniform shape and size. Foam can also assume different dimensions by increasing/reducing the volume of silk droplet giving rise to different organoid size in culture.
units.rationale: Explains how foam manipulation determines final organoid dimensions.
